snippet: The addition of a cheaper iPhone could help Apple sell tens of millions more phones, but it could also diminish its reputation as a premium brand.
abstract: Apple is introducing two iPhones, including a new lower-cost model targeted at overseas countries where expensive smartphones are out of reach for many consumers; addition of a cheaper iPhone could help Apple sell tens of millions more phones, but it could also diminish its reputation as a premium brand; many luxury companies have faced this challenge before, with wildly different results.

byline.contributor: Stephanie Clifford and Bill Vlasic contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The addition of a cheaper iPhone could help Apple sell tens of millions more phones, but it could also diminish its reputation as a premium brand.

headline.main: Luxury Brands Face Hazards When Testing Lower Costs
